answer.description: enable it to withstand higher voltages

question.description: Stars twinkle because

answer.description: the intensity of light emitted by them changes with time
the refractive index of the different layers of the earth's atmosphere changes continuously, consequently the position of the image of a start changes with time
the distance of the stars from the earth changes with time

question.description: Superconductors are substances which

answer.description: offer no resistance to the flow of electricity
offer high resistance to the flow of current

question.description: Light travels at the fastest speed in
Radio telescopes are better than optical telescopes because

answer.description: they can detect faint galaxies which no optical telescope can
they can work during the day and night
they can work even in cloudy conditions

question.description: Light Emitting Diodes (LED) is used in fancy electronic devices such as toys emit
Optical fibre works on the
Rainbow is due to

answer.description: absorption of sunlight in minute water droplets
refraction and reflection of sunlight by water droplets
diffusion of sunlight through water droplets

question.description: Stars which appear single to the naked eye but are double when seen through a telescope are
Solar eclipse will take place when

answer.description: the sun is between the moon and the earth
the moon is between the sun and the earth
the earth is between the moon and the sun
the moon does not lie on the line joining the sun and the earth

question.description: Isotopes of an element contain

answer.description: the same number of neutrons but different number of protons
the same number of protons but different number of neutrons
equal number of protons and electrons

Planets are

answer.description: luminous heavenly bodies revolving around a star
luminous heavenly bodies that do not twinkle

question.description: Mica is used in electrical appliances such as electric iron because mica is

answer.description: a bad conductor of heat but a good conductor of electricity
a good conductor of heat but a bad conductor of electricity
a good conductor of heat as well as electricity
a bad conductor of heat as well as electricity

answer.description: depends on the nature of the metal.
is same for all metals and independent of the intensity of the incident radiation.

question.description: An ideal choke draws a current of 8A when connected to an AC supply of 100 V, 50 Hz. A pure resistor draws a current of 10 A when connected to the same source. answer.description: interference of sunlight reflected from the water surface
scattering of sunlight by the water molecules

question.description: Critical angle for certain medium is Sin-1 (0.6). The polarizing angle of that medium is

answer.description: in randomly oriented planes but vibrating in phase.
in mutually perpendicular planes but vibrating in phase.
in mutually perpendicular planes but vibrating with a phase difference of p
in mutually perpendicular planes but vibrating with a phase difference of p/f

question.description: For a series LCR circuit at resonance, the statement which is not true is

answer.description: Peak energy stored by a capacitor = peak energy stored by an inductor

answer.description: it contains only a single electron

question.description: If an electron and a proton have the same de-Broglie wavelength, then the kinetic energy of the electron is

answer.description: Potential at p is more than that at n
Potential at p is less than that at n

Potential at p is +ve and that at n is -ve

fringes of unequal width are formed.
